ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Skills in counterpoint, harmony, throughbass, and form.
Introduction to counterpoint, harmony, and form
Knowledge of counterpoint. harmony and form; the application of this knowledge to the study of early music
Various species of counterpoint, decorations, thoroughbass, and form

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Sometimes the language the professors used were inaccessible for someone without much theory background, but meeting with the TA helped me a lot. The workload was also too much in the beginning but got better as the course went along.
Strengths - introduced me to a variety of theory concepts and was interesting to analyze pieces.

Amazing course - Prof. Harrison is one of the best instructors I've had at Yale so far, and his 30+ years of teaching music theory really shines in course. It was a lot of work during the counterpoint portion of the course, but the hw was immensely rewarding, and none of it felt like busy work.
Interesting assignments of reasonable length, great Professor + TFs. There could be some more practice in class leading up to assignments.

The course is well-organized and engaging throughout! The only weakness I can think of is that the counterpoint homework assignments at the beginning of the term can be quite time-consuming, in contrast to the later assignments which are shorter. I'm not sure what changes can be made to address this, but it did feel like the workload varied quite significantly depending on which topics we were covering.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: They adapted well to using the virtual format

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: If you need to credit for lessons, yes. Otherwise, prepare yourself for a challenge and make time for it.
If said student likes music theory, then absolutely; this student would find the material and discussions very engaging. Otherwise, the assignments might feel tedious.

Yes! I would definitely recommend this course to anyone interested in classical music (in particular the Baroque and Classical periods), as well as anyone interested in composition. Note that the workload (especially at the beginning) can be quite heavy though.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Combination of live virtual and recorded lectures, along with a multitude of worksheets which reinforced covered content.
